intro: Atractylis lanata, commonly known as the hairy cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies. Atractylis lanata is also valued for its role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitats.
